name: unsinkable
content:
unsinkable adjective
(SHIP)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a ship or a boat is unsinkable, it cannot be sunk: An iceberg sank the "Titanic" - a ship they claimed was unsinkable.
More examplesFewer examplesMore than 1,500 lives were lost in the accident, which occurred when the supposedly unsinkable ship hit an iceberg. Proclaimed to be unsinkable, the battleship was destroyed after the Reconnaissance Unit spotted her at sea.the role of USS Great Britain as Nato's unsinkable aircraft carrierThey hoped to gain some 'secret' military information about the fleet, such as how it was possible to sink a supposedly unsinkable ship.

unsinkable adjective
(PERSON)
full of energy and enthusiasm, and not able to be defeated or to fail: She was staying with her grandmother, the unsinkable Olga.
